required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adjuvant Whole Breast Irradiation in Five Fractions Versus Fifteen Fractions in Early Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Adjuvant Whole Breast Irradiation in Five Fractions Versus Fifteen Fractions in Early Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: the study aiming for compairing results of hypofractionaton radiotherapy treatment in patient with early breast cancer between two arms the first arm recieving five fractions and the other arm recieving fifteen fraction

primary_outcome.description: the period time from treatment till death

intervention.description: the patient first is simulated then delineation is done

study_pop.textblock: the study includes patients with early breast cancer recieving adjuvant radiotherapy in hypofractionation pattern the first arm recieving 15 fraction and the seconed arm recieving five fractions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age group ( 18-80) years
- breast conservation surgery
- Stages (pT1-3, pN0-1, M0) breast cancer.
- Any histological type of invasive breast cancer.
- All grades of breast cancer (I,II,III)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Stage (III or IV) breast cancer.
- Metastatic breast cancer (MBC)
- Recurrent breast cancer.
- Patients' co-morbidities that contraindicate radiotherapy

responsible_party.investigator_title: assistant lecturer of oncolgy. sohag university hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: adjuvant whole breast irradiation in five fractions versus fifteen fraction in early breast cancer
